Kanishka Narayan
Member of Parliament for the Vale of Glamorgan
Working tirelessly to champion a fairer, more prosperous future, I am proud to serve as the Labour MP for the Vale of Glamorgan.
A brighter tomorrow for the Vale of Glamorgan
With a strong track record at the heart of government, in international business and in community volunteering, I am dedicated to ensuring that the voices of Vale residents are heard in Westminster.
Proud to be a Labour MP in the Vale
The Labour Party has been a vehicle of exceptional progress for our country. For my family, it has meant the dignity of a good minimum wage. It has meant the opportunity of contributing to thriving public services (my parents in law, my brother in the NHS, me in our civil service). And above all, growing up under the last Labour government, it has meant a country that prospered, giving us purpose. I am proud to be part of a Labour government that is again putting our country and our future at the heart of our politics.
Putting our community above everything
My mission for the Vale is focused on two things: dignity and prosperity for everyone in the Vale of Glamorgan. That is why I work tirelessly to address the issues that matter most – good jobs in the Vale, opportunity for our kids, cutting our bills, cleaning our water, and making our community safe.
Delivering for the Vale of Glamorgan: My key priorities
When I ran for election, I knocked nearly 50,000 doors and spoke to over 20,000 of my neighbours. Based on those conversations, I am focused on three priorities: delivering a 1,000 job opportunities, backing our community organisations, and tackling rising antisocial behaviour in our community.
All hands on tech
I will create 1,000 job opportunities for Vale residents by 2030. It is an ambitious goal, but if we achieve it, it will revive the heritage of innovation we have in the Vale of Glamorgan. I am doing everything to make it happen. Join me?
Community first
Within my first 6 months as the Vale’s MP, I have secured £40m from the UK Government for Barry and the Vale of Glamorgan. I am listening to you and will keep putting your voice at the heart of our plans.
Tough on crime tough on the causes
I stood on a campaign to invest more in community policing, in support for young kids before they go on the wrong track, and in community amenities that make our Vale cleaner and safer. I will deliver on it, working with leaders in our community (like world boxing champion, Lee Selby, pictured here).

About Me
South Wales has given me and my family so much of what we cherish: a warm welcome for my parents and their two young boys; the dignity of decent work in our public services; the promise of future opportunity in education and work.
I am determined to give back and am privileged to have the chance to do so as the Welsh Labour MP for the Vale of Glamorgan.
My mission: to spread opportunity to every child in the Vale of Glamorgan, and across Wales
Born in Bihar, India, I moved to Cardiff with my family at the age of 12. We were in a modest one-bedroom flat in Bedford Street. Each morning, my brother and I walked to Cathays High School to get a good Welsh education. My mum and dad still live and work within walking distance of where we grew up.
For me, as for so many others, teachers changed the course of my life. One of them carried an irrational belief in my ability and urged me to apply for scholarships to private schools. I still remember the day I asked our Headteacher, Mr Phillips, to sign a scholarship form for Eton College as he broke up a school-bus fight. He seemed totally surprised. My youthful naivety ignored it.
I have had the deepest privileges of education since – generous bursary support that allowed me to attend Eton; undergraduate education in Philosophy, Politics and Economics at Balliol College, Oxford; an MBA at Stanford University in the USA. Throughout it, I have never forgotten a simple reality: there was no difference in talent between my friends at Cathays in Cardiff, and my friends at each of the institutions I experienced since. There was only difference in opportunity.
That simple reality is why I founded Attain Wales at university, a mentoring programme to support Welsh state school kids get access to top universities. It’s why I cofounded a student thinktank to tackle homelessness. And now, it’s why I pursue politics with a simple mission: to spread opportunity to every child in the Vale of Glamorgan, and across Wales.
Work and community: international experience, grounded in Wales
I am determined to bring everything I have learnt - from the heart of government, from business across the UK and Silicon Valley, and from community work – to the service of the Vale of Glamorgan.
In government, I advised Cabinet ministers and the Prime Minister at both the Business department and the Cabinet Office as Economist and Senior Adviser. I then served as Expert Adviser to Britain’s Environment Secretary, helping write the UK’s 25-year environment plan to protect the nature and landscape that defines our country.
In business, I worked at Lazard, advising FTSE boards, government finance ministries, and tech start-up entrepreneurs across Europe and the US. After completing my MBA, I entered global technology, spending time in Silicon Valley and the UK. I supported leading entrepreneurs in AI, fintech, and climate change initiatives. Later, I used this experience to serve as Head of Tech Policy for Labour’s Shadow Digital Secretary. I remain convinced that changing technology offers the greatest opportunity for the Vale, and for Britain, to reclaim its proud heritage of innovation.
At the heart of my work, I have valued deep community engagement. I used my experience in finance to produce national research on supporting households in severe debt, and volunteered with Citizens Advice and the Trussell Trust.
As Labour’s MP candidate and now MP, my campaign was built on relentless door-to-door engagement and an unwavering commitment to local issues: my volunteer team and I knocked 30,000 doors, delivered medicines as volunteers, picked litter, delivered post with the Royal Mail, raised money for RNLI, and supported our veterans.
In the 2024 general election, I proudly won the Vale of Glamorgan seat, returning it to Labour after 14 years of Conservative representation. Shortly after, I was appointed as Parliamentary Private Secretary at the Department for Environment, Food and Rural Affairs, where I work to shape policy in areas including environmental sustainability, rural affairs, and food systems.
I continue to live in the Vale of Glamorgan, close to my family and the community that has shaped my journey. My path—from the warmest community in Cardiff to the halls of Parliament—motivates me each day to bring opportunity and a passion for public service to every kid in the Vale of Glamorgan and across the UK.
